page.title: 11After the flood in Cornholme
page.content: In 1982 there was a bad flood and a trail of destruction was left through Cornholme along the Burnley Road and also along the Bacup Road on the other side of the moor. Although no lives were lost in the flood there was considerable damge to property and personal belongings. The damage was restricted to the area along the Burnley Road and resulted in one house and a factory having to be demolished. There was also a lot of damage to cars and caravans. The end result of the flood was a trail of mud along the street and through the houses.A great effort was made by local services to normalise things and a tremendous atmosphere of caring and helping each other was evident after the flood. Work is now in hand to stop more flooding and hopefully such a disaster will not be seen again.
